Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

ALLEGATION:
Three youth at the facility are on the autism spectrum and require supervision at all
times. Youth B and C have a history of inappropriate contact. On 2/11/22, youth A
was allowed in the bathroom by staff without checking for vacancy. Youth A and B
2

were alone together in the bathroom. Another staff stepped away shortly after,
leaving Youth B and C alone in the hall and they were observed embracing.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 14, 2022. Staff 1
reported on February 11, 2022, she was assisting Youth B with getting set up to
brush her teeth before bedtime. Staff 1 reported she went to the staff office to put the
toothpaste back since Youth B was brushing her teeth. Staff 1 reported during that
time she saw Staff 2 with Youth A and Youth C in the milieu. Staff 1 reported Youth
A ran to the restroom and Staff 2 let her in. The restroom Youth A entered was the
same restroom Youth B was in brushing her teeth. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to
mess with the toilet because it was clogged. Youth A was assisted out of the
restroom since the toilet was previously clogged and Youth B was still brushing her
teeth. Staff 1 noted both Youth A and Youth B were never alone in the restroom due
to staff having supervision. Staff 1 reported she began to work on unclogging the
toilet. Staff 1 noted Youth B hovered over her while she tempted to unclog the toilet
and Staff 1 asked for Youth B to give some space. Youth B slammed the restroom
door when she left because she was frustrated with Staff 1. Staff 1 reported she
attempted to fix the toilet for 15 more seconds after Youth B left. Staff 1 reported for
those 15 seconds, Staff 2 would have been with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C.
Staff 1 reported when she left the restroom and into the hall, she saw the three youth
but not Staff 2. Staff 1 said the last time she knew Staff 2 was in the hall with the
youth. Staff 1 noted in less than a minute Staff 2 appeared in the milieu from the
office. She was unsure where Staff 2 came from. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 and Staff 4
told her they saw Youth C kiss Youth B’s back and there were no staff present. Staff
1 noted the youth were unsupervised for what she believes to be under a minute.
Staff 1 said in the future the team needs to have better communication about who
has eyes on what youth and if they need another staff member to watch a youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 14, 2022. Staff 2
reported on February 11, 2022, he had just come back to the unit with Youth A from
having a snack. Staff 2 said Youth A indicated she had to use the restroom and Staff
2 opened the door for her. Staff 2 reported he did not know that Youth B was in the
restroom brushing her teeth. Staff 2 reported he was able to get Youth A out of the
restroom once he saw Youth B in there as well. He reported this lasted a couple of
seconds and he had eyes on both youth during that situation. Staff 2 reported while
he was out in the milieu with Youth A, Youth B asked him to put her toothbrush
away. Staff 2 reported he put Youth B’s toothbrush back in the staff office and
washed his hands. He reported during that time he believed Staff 1 was unclogging
the toilet in the restroom. Staff 2 reported Youth C came back from having snack but
there was no communication to Staff 2 that Youth C was coming on the unit. Staff 2
reported he realized Youth C was on the unit when he walked out of the staff office.
Later that night, Staff 2 heard from other staff members an incident report needed to
be completed because Youth C had kissed Youth B’s back when there was no staff
3

present. Staff 2 reported it must have occurred when he was in the staff office. Staff
2 reported the ratio for the youth on the unit is two youth to one staff member. He
reported when he came onto shift that day it was identified he would be the staff
member to work with Youth A. Staff 2 reported the team could have had better
communication on shift because he was unaware Youth C was coming back on the
unit or that he needed to watch Youth B while Staff 1 was unclogging the toilet.
Youth A is non-verbal youth. This consultant viewed Youth A’s interactions
with staff at was at the facility on February 14, 2022. Youth A appeared to be in
positive spirits and interacting with staff members on the unit.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 14, 2022.
Youth B reported she does not remember the toilet being clogged this past week or
Youth A walking into the restroom when she was brushing her teeth. Youth B
reported she has a good relationship with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth B reported she
feels safe at DART, and she has made some friends on her unit. Youth B was asked
if any of her peers have kissed or hugged her, Youth B reported it happened one
time with Youth C. Youth B reported Youth C had kissed and hugged her one time
many months ago (this was investigated in SI2022C0114011). This consultant asked
Youth B if this happened again this past Friday and Youth B reported no. Youth B
reported nothing happened this past Friday, February 11, 2022.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 14, 2022. Youth
C was hesitant to talk with this consultant and indicated he did not want to speak
because he does not know this consultant. Youth C reported he likes DART and has
no concerns with any staff. Youth C asked for the interview to be over and
proceeded to leave the room.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone at the facility on February 16, 2022. Staff 3
reported she was working on February 11, 2022. She reported there was four staff,
and five children present that day. Around 7pm, the team was in the cafeteria eating
snack before bedtime. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 took Youth A, Youth B and
Youth C back to unit to get ready for bed. Staff 3 reported she stayed with the other
youth that were finishing up snack. Staff 3 reported when she walked back with Staff
4 they saw Youth A, Youth B and Youth C were by the staff door and did not see any
staff present. Staff 3 reported she saw Youth C giving Youth B a side hug. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 appeared within 10 seconds of Staff 3 seeing the youth
alone. Staff 3 reported she saw Staff 1 come from the client bathroom and Staff 2
come from the staff bathroom. When asked about safety plans for Youth C, Staff 3
reported Youth C should not be next to Youth B without staff being around due to the
prior investigation.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone at the facility on February 17, 2022. Staff 4
reported she was working on February 11, 2022. Staff 4 reported she was working
on the other side of the unit but had lost her phone during the time of late snack.
Staff 4 reported she walked over by the other unit side and saw Youth A, Youth B,
4

and Youth C alone on the unit. Staff 4 asked the youth where their staff members
were, and the youth did not say anything. She reported Youth B did say Youth C had
kissed her. Staff 4 reported when she saw the youth alone that Youth C was hugging
Youth B. Staff 4 reported she knocked on the restroom door and Staff 1 walked out.
Staff 4 also reported when Staff 1 appeared from the youth’s restroom, Staff 2 also
came from the staff office/restroom area. Staff 4 reported she thinks the youth were
alone for about a minute. When asked if she is aware of any safety plans for Youth B
and Youth C, Staff 4 reported both youth are to not be right next to one another and
in line of sight of staff at all times.
Documents Reviewed:
 DART Incident Report (1) from February 11, 2022- The report indicates Youth B
was in the restroom brushing her teeth and Staff 2 allowed Youth A into the same
restroom. Youth A did not use the restroom and was escorted out of the
restroom. It was found the toilet was clogged.
 DART incident Report (2) from February 11, 2022- The report indicated Staff 3
and Staff 4 walked onto the unit and found Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C alone
in the hallway unattended. It was noted when youth were asked where staff were,
Staff 1 came out of the consumer unit bathroom and Staff 2 came out of the staff
unit bathroom.
 Resident Supervision Guideline- This policy states staff at DART main job
expectation is supervision of residents. It notes in the milieu staff will have
residents in their line of sight at all time. It also states if the youth walk down the
hallway staff are to position themselves to be able to see all youth. The policy
states that staff are expected to verbally communicate with their team members
where they are and if they need to move positions throughout the shift.
 Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment Staff to Resident Ratio- The
policy notes at a minimum, the child to staff ratio at DART is two youth to one
staff during awake hours and four youth to one staff for normal sleeping hours. ‘
 Youth B’s Safety plan dated November 6, 2021- This safety plan notes Youth B
has a history of poor personal boundaries and invading another peer’s privacy
when they think that staff are not monitoring them. The plan notes staff should
keep Youth B in their line of sight at all times when they are in the milieu.
 Youth C’s Safety Plan dated November 30, 2021- This safety plan was
developed by Youth C’s direct foster care worker. This safety plan was signed by
DART’s case manager and clinical manager. The safety plan stated staff will
keep Youth C in line of sight of staff at all times when he is in the milieu. Line of
sight meant that staff ware able to see Youth C and what he is doing, and staff
are making certain that he is being safe. Staff will not assume that another staff
member has line of sight on Youth C. Staff will have visual monitoring of the
hallway when Staff C is down the hallway, using the restroom, or in his bedroom.
 Human Resource file for Staff 1 and Staff 2- There were no disciplinary or
performance evaluations that reflected poorly pertaining to Staff 1 and Staff 2’s
5

work with youth at the facility. Training records were viewed and noted Staff 1
and Staff 2 were up to date on training requirements.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as both Youth B and
Youth C have safety plans developed noting Staff should always
have them in their line of sight. On February 11, 2021, both
Youth B and Youth C were found to not be in supervision of staff
and were reported to be embracing one another.
Technical Assistance:
This consultant recommends the team re-reviewing the safety
plans for the youth. Add in a training about the importance of
team communication.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
